spec.scope: Specification for the description and identification of the published resources

info.p: ISBD stands for International Standards Bibliographic Description. The standard was developed by IFLA. Its first preliminary version was published in 1971 and its lastest version in 2011.

ISBD specifies the requirements for description and identification of single-part resources and multipart resources, such as printed and electronic texts, images, audios, multimedia resources and more. It has 8 areas of descriptions:

ul.li: Title and statement of responsibility area
Material or type of resource specific area
Series and multipart monographic resource area
Resource identifier and terms of availability area

info.p: Each area is optimized for the description of the resources under various aspects, which are helpful to identify and to select in any type of catalogue by using special punctuations.
